intro: Rubus dissimulans var. serrulatus, commonly known as the serrated blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically edible. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along fences. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Rubus genus.
